page.title: 07Castle, Uppingham, Rutland
page.content: The remains of a motte and bailey castle occur to the west of the Leicester Road. Access is alongside a parish boundary hedge almost opposite the last house on the Leicester Road, going away from Uppingham. The motte (raised mound) overlooks Wardley Wood and is covered in trees and scrub, presumably because of a lack of grazing on the steep sides. Three parish boundary lines converge about the motte. The bailey part is now a cereal-covered flat field between the motte and the Leicester Road. The castle is mentioned in{The } {Mediaeval Earthworks of Rutland}by{R.} {F. Hartley}and published by Leicestershire Museums.
